title: U.S. insurers seek steep rate hikes for companies hit by catastrophes
text: February 14, 2018 / 3:12 PM / Updated 30 minutes ago U.S. insurers seek steep rate hikes for companies hit by catastrophes Reuters Staff 1 Min Read (Reuters) - U.S. commercial insurers are seeking double-digit rate hikes in catastrophe-prone areas, broker Willis Towers Watson ( WLTW.O ) said in a report on Wednesday. Companies that have already suffered catastrophe losses are facing rate hikes of 20 to 25 percent, while those in catastrophe-prone areas face hikes of 10 to 20 percent, Willis Towers Watson said. Reporting by Suzanne Barlyn; Editing by Bernadette Baum
